e4: Maintaining the current policy, though seemingly beneficial in the short term, is ethically questionable and unsustainable.  Switching to the new policy promotes transparency and long-term trust with investors. While there may be initial negative market reactions, the enhanced reputation and reduced risk of future scandals outweigh this short-term concern.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency, accuracy, and fairness.  It avoids manipulation or bias, ensuring all stakeholders have access to the same, unbiased information.  It also considers the potential impact on different investor groups, aiming for a level playing field, and complies with all relevant accounting standards and regulations.  Consistency over time is crucial for building trust.
e6: I would ask about the detailed plan for communicating the policy change to investors, including specific messaging and timelines.  I'd also want to understand their assessment of the potential short-term market impact and their strategy for mitigating any negative consequences. Finally, I'd inquire about how they will monitor and measure the effectiveness of the new policy post-implementation.
